snippet: With the Serbian economy lagging, voters are expected on Sunday to show their disenchantment with the government of Boris Tadic, which has advocated for membership to the bloc.
abstract: Serbia's presidential candidate and Socialist Party leader Ivica Dacic has won wide support by mixing patriotism and pragmatism with an appeal to social justice; Dacic, interior minister in coalition government of country's pro-Western president Boris Tadic, is expected to be the kingmaker in upcoming elections, and is being talked about as the next prime minister.
lead_paragraph: With the Serbian economy lagging, voters are expected on Sunday to show their disenchantment with the government of Boris Tadic, which has advocated for membership to the bloc.

headline.main: Serbs Losing Fervor for European Union Accession
headline.print_headline: Serbian Socialist Leader May Be Crucial to Forming a Government After Election
